meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an autarch.
meanings.sent1: The autarchical leader made all the decisions for the country.
meanings.sent2: The autarchical government had complete control over its policies.
meanings.sent3: The autarchical ruler decided to ban all foreign goods, causing a shortage of supplies.
meanings.sent4: Her autarchical nature in the group project made her the undisputed leader.
meanings.sent5: The autarchical system of governance was both efficient and restrictive.

meanings.sent1: The community had an autarchical council that made local decisions.
meanings.sent2: She had an autarchical approach to managing her finances.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed autarchical, choosing when to come and go as it pleased.
meanings.sent4: The autarchical student decided to study independently for the exam.
meanings.sent5: His autarchical behavior at work sometimes clashed with the team's collaborative efforts.
